page.title: 07LOCAL SCHOOLS
page.content: Pudsey has a total of fifteen schools,including Fulneck - a private school catering for boys and girls separately.Of the rest,twelve were run by the West Riding Education Authority.Five of these are combined junior/infant schools with pupils aged 5-11,two are infant schools(5-7),two more are junior schools(7-11) and three are high schools(11-18) - Crawshaw,Priesthorpe and Grangefield. The other two schools,Swinnow Middle (9-13) and Hough Side High(13-18),were outside the old Pudsey Borough and were the responsibility of the Leeds City Council.Hence the different age-ranges.Both systems produce a good standard of education.The total school population in the state system in Pudsey is about 5,500.The oldest school in the area is Primrose Hill which was originally a 'board school'.
